intro: Gnaphalium paronychioides, commonly known as the mouse-eared chickweed, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Gnaphalium paronychioides is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
